messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] dyslexia from the inside
messages.msgSnippet: I m so glad you posted! I m the mother of an 11 yo dyslexic -- we ve spent a great deal of time in occupational therapy, and we ve learned amazing things. I
messages.messageBody:
I'm so glad you posted! I'm the mother of an 11 yo dyslexic -- we've spent a great deal of time in occupational therapy, and we've learned amazing things. I don't have personal experience with it, as you do, but I can speak to some of the wonderful things they're doing with young children now, too.
----- Original Message -----
From: Diana E
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, December 02, 2001 7:00 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] dyslexia from the inside


I am dyslexic. Never heard the term until age 23. My
older daughter is dyslexic. We homeschooled, then she
took her GED, ACT, attended community college --
mainly to prove to herself that she could -- has
worked full-time since age 16, makes twice as much
money as I do. If there is interest on this list I
will write at length about my perception, research,
and learning/teaching techniques.

=====
Diana

messages.msgSnippet: ... I m interested.  I d also like to hear more about your daughter, if that s ok with her.  I m quite interested in the homeschooled/unschooled kids who
messages.messageBody:
At 07:00 AM 02/12/01 -0800, you wrote:
>I am dyslexic. Never heard the term until age 23. My
>older daughter is dyslexic. We homeschooled, then she
>took her GED, ACT, attended community college --
>mainly to prove to herself that she could -- has
>worked full-time since age 16, makes twice as much
>money as I do. If there is interest on this list I
>will write at length about my perception, research,
>and learning/teaching techniques.

I'm interested. I'd also like to hear more about your daughter, if that's
ok with her. I'm quite interested in the homeschooled/unschooled kids who
didn't go the academic route to a career.
Tia

Tia Leschke leschke@...
On Vancouver Island
********************************************************************************************
It is the answers which separate us, the questions which unite us. - Janice
Levy

Thankyou so much for offering to share your personal
experiences.
Sharon
